name: Asimo
description: A humanoid robot developed by Honda, capable of walking and interacting with humans.
history: Asimo was the first humanoid robot capable of walking on two legs without a support frame.

name: Spot
description: A versatile quadruped robot developed by Boston Dynamics, used for various applications including exploration and delivery.
history: Spot is known for its ability to navigate complex terrains and perform tasks in challenging environments.

name: Ameca
description: Engineered Arts' latest and most advanced humanoid robot, Ameca, is a development platform for AI and machine learning systems.
history: Ameca is highlighted for its advanced capabilities in human-like movements and interactions, making it a significant development in the field of humanoid robotics.

name: Atlas
description: A humanoid robot developed by Boston Dynamics, designed for advanced mobility and dexterity.
history: Atlas is renowned for its ability to perform complex tasks such as opening doors and picking up objects.

name: Pepper
description: A humanoid robot designed by SoftBank Robotics for social interaction and entertainment.
history: Pepper was the first robot to be sold to consumers, designed to engage in conversations and entertain users.

name: Beomni
description: Created by Beyond Imagination, Beomni is controlled remotely by human pilots using VR headsets and other wearable devices, with AI assisting in task learning.
history: Beyond Imagination CEO and co-founder Harry Kloor expressed hope that Beomni will revolutionize elder care and take on more challenging tasks in various industries.

name: Next-generation Digit
description: A next-generation humanoid robot by Agility Robotics, optimized for various applications including e-commerce and shipping warehouses.
history: Digit is known for its enhanced features, including newly designed end effectors and improved human-robot interaction capabilities.

name: Phoenix
description: A humanoid robot unveiled by Sanctuary AI, showcasing advanced capabilities in human-like movements and interactions.
history: Phoenix represents a significant step forward in the development of humanoid robots with near-term commercial aspirations.

name: GR-01
description: A humanoid robot by Fourier Intelligence, designed for advanced mobility and interaction with humans.
history: GR-01 is part of the growing trend of humanoid robots entering the labor force, with a focus on commercial applications.

name: Apollo
description: A humanoid robot by Apptronik, demonstrating advanced human-like movements and interaction capabilities.
history: Apollo is part of the competitive race among humanoid robots, aiming to bring advanced robotics to the consumer market.

name: Figure 01
description: A humanoid robot by Figure, showcasing advanced design and capabilities in human-like movements and interactions.
history: Figure 01 represents a significant investment in the development of humanoid robots, with a focus on commercial viability.

name: Optimus Generation 2
description: A humanoid robot by Tesla, designed for advanced manufacturing and assembly line operations.
history: Optimus Generation 2 is Tesla's entry into the humanoid robot market, initially developed for use in Tesla automotive factories.
